story:
WHAT IS IT?  MIMOTO SMART PEN 2 is the only multifunctional smart pen in the world that records hand writing in real-time and at the same time, using our software and sensors can upgrade computer screens to have touch screen capabilities.

 Mimoto Smart Pen upgrades your windows computer to have touch screen capabilities! Simply attach the touch screen receiver to the side of your monitor, install our software and change the pen's ink refill in to a stylus refill and you're ready to explore the full potential of touch screen capabilities. With the touch screen feature you can browse the web, play video games, draw or write, just like you would with a stylus



MIMOTO SMART PEN 2 It looks and writes just like any other ballpoint pen but uses high powered ultrasound and infrared sensors, just like the once found in your popular gaming consoles to detect body motion. We modified our sensors to detect hand and pen motion.  After attaching a receiver to the top of a standard sheet of paper the Mimoto Pen’s sensors  go to work and start to record your hand writing and transfer it in real-time to any one of your portable devices.




Get access to thousands of video games that were previously only available through your phone or touchpad touch screen. WITH OUR SMARTPEN TOUCH FEATURES AND SOFTWARE you can now access and play the same video games as provided on GOOGLE.

Google Play currently has over 450,000 available games to play.

                   



Amiweb :  "Team of engineers and designers from Mimoto Tech have developed yet another innovative product"

AppleMagazine: "A fun and new way for students and working professionals to take notes"

iPhone Developers Journal: " It's a great product with a lot of potential to revolutionize the way we look at note taking"

Reuters: " Mimoto Tech's engineers used the latest Ultrasound and Infrared sensors to develop Mimoto Pen"

Daily News: "Mimoto Smart Pen enables touch screen capability on your computer; now that's innovative"



MIMOTO SMART PEN 2 is the perfect productivity tool for in a busy workplace.

Never lose your notes again. The pen automatically records your notes to either the sensors/receiver or to a paired device of your choice, like your iPhone, Android phone or touchpad.

The pen’s software automatically takes your writings and turns them into editable text.




In 2014 we started a KICKSTARTER campaign. We've just completed our deliveries and are ready to do it again with additional upgrades!

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mimototech/mimoto-smartpen


Our First Production Run After Kickstarter


It can be an accessory for your I-Phones, Androids, I-Pads Touch Pads and Computers.


                      

                                    Before Mimomoto Smart Pen

                                    


                                 After Mimoto Smart Pen and Software

                                   

USING THE TOUCH FEATURES




DELIVERY SCHEDULE

FAQ

  • What devices are supported by Mimoto Smart Pen?

Our smart pen supports almost all devices out there, including; i-Phone, i-Pad, Android phones and touch pads, Blackberry devices, MAC and PC. This is for recording all your writing. The touch screen feature is currently only supported by Window's OS.

  • What is the memory capability of the Smart Pen?

2MB or about 100 A4 pages of writing or sketching recording.

  • Does the Smart Pen support Linux or Ubuntu?

Currently it does not. But we promised our backers that we will look into this if there's enough demand.

  • Can you manage the recorded writings via Note Apps?

Yes, you can send all you sketches to your favorite note app or via email.

  • How big of a screen size is supported for the Touch Feature?

The Touch Feature of the pen supports screen sizes up to 26 inches.

  • How can you use one pen as both a stylus and to write with?

The pen has interchangeable refills. One is for stylus, the other is for writing. If you are writing and want to use it to draw, simply change the refill to a stylus refill and you're ready to go.

  • Is the Pen pressure sensitive?

Yes, the pen is pressure sensitive, thus it will only work as you are putting light pressure on the pen. Then it gives out a signal and communicates with the receiver.

  • Does the pen work only as companion with mobile devices?

Yes and NO. The pen works with all mobile devices but at the same time it can work on standalone mode, where it records writings directly to the receiver. When you're ready to work with your sketches or writings, simply hook up the receiver to a computer via USB cord and you're ready to work.

  • What languages does the Smart Pen support?

Mimoto Smart Pen supports up to 30 different languages:  Arabic, Catalan, Chinese ( Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Czech, Danish, Dutch, English (Canada), English (UK), English (USA), Finnish, French (Canada), French, (France), German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Kazakh, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil), Portuguese (Portugal), Russian, Spanish (Mexico), Spanish (Spain), Swedish, Turkish, Vietnamese.

story:
Our Story

There are many smart bulbs in the market right now. However, none of them are affordable. The gold standard of all smart bulbs the Philips hue retails for $59.97USD..but seriously, who can afford that?

Other brands similar to the hue markets for $40-45. There are ones selling between $20-30 but they are simply just aren't bright enough, the reason why they cost so low is because they are using 3-5w LED chips instead of the 7-9w which is equivalent to the 60w traditional incandescent bulbs.

Also don't forget the cost of a hub which can go for $40-80. The Spaceman smart bulb will be powered by Bluetooth 4.0 meaning there will be no need for additional hardware.

Our mission then was set to find a way to pack this bulb with features and introduce it at an affordable price.

How much will Spaceman Lighting's Smart Bulb sell for?

drum roll please...

$28.95!

Before we tell you how we could get the cost down so low we would like to first introduce the product:

Powerful 7W bulb

The most important feature we focused on was the functionality of the light. We wanted to make sure the bulb was bright enough for daily tasks before spending any budget on the playful aspect of the product. The bulb boasts a strong 690 lumen which is the equivalent to a 60w incandescent bulb.


From Warm White to Cool white

The only smart bulb out right now where you can control the color temperature! From 3000k which is a warm “yellow” light to 6000k which is a cool “white” light. Again, we wanted to focus a little more on the functionality of the light. For relaxing tasks like reading, a warm light will provide more comfort. For practical tasks like cleaning, a brighter and crisp white light will help the eye to catch dirty spots in the room.


Dimmable

We actually find it funny our competitors claim to have a “smart” bulb when their product lacks basic feature like dimming. The Spaceman smart bulb will be able to go from full 100% down to 30% brightness. Be in control of your light.


Now for the fun stuff:

RGB

Guests are coming over? Time to set the mood! Latest RGB technology with technically millions of colors to choose. Impress the lady or gentlemen you are having over ;)


Group control


Control 1, 2, or 64 at once! Our grouping feature allows you to organize up to 64 bulbs and control them as a single unit.


Music mode

Turn your room into a dance floor! Plug a few in and have it follow to the music - voila, you are now the owner of the hottest club in town :D


Timer

Let the light assist you. Set wake up and sleep functions so you can have a more natural rest. Doubles as a security feature in case you are out of town and need to create the illusion of having someone in the house.


With that many features, how do we get our cost to be so low?

Harnessing the efficiency of e commerce.

Shopify & fulfilment centers

We have found the top fulfilment centers used by Amazon sellers and narrowed it down to the most reliable yet cost prudent warehouses. Also instead of developing our own app we have licensed existing technology so we do not need to include a recovery fee for the research and development like the big guys.

Most importantly, we only plan to sell direct through Shopify. Most brands out there want to wholesale their products to distributors so they have to set a high retail price. Only by doing so they can attract distributors with a healthy profit margin. Spaceman Lighting however understands the competitive disadvantage of focusing on the b2b model instead of the end user when selling having a narrow product line.

Once we have successfully launched the product we will get to working on expanding our product line right away. Our vision is to not only have E27 bulbs but also encompass different types of light sources, such as flexible LED strips as well as GU10 spot lights. Our goal is to able to let users fully control their lighting environment around them for under $100. 

Product Specs.

  • Wireless Spec: Bluetooth 4.0
  • Bluetooth Range: 15 meters
  • Power: 7w
  • Input Voltage: AC100-240V
  • Lumens: 690lm
  • Color temperature: 3000k-6000k & RGB 16 million colors
  • Supported OS: IPhone 4S/Android 4.3 & above
  • Safety Certifications: UL, cUL, CE

PRODUCT ROADMAP

1) SMART PHONE CONTROLLED FLEXIBLE LED STRIPS.

2) 5w VERSION OF THE BULB FOR ONLY $19.95!

3) SMART PHONE CONTROLLED GU10 SPOTLIGHT.

4) INTEGRATION OF COLOR CHANGING LED TO EVERYDAY ITEMS

+ MANY MORE

Risks & Challenges

As long as the campaign goal is reached we are confident in fulfilling the promotional orders in this campaign. However, due to the competitiveness in this industry the challenge would be being able to sustain the project with our low margins to achieve a full on product line as explain in the our vision portion of the campaign.  

We hope to be able to offer a full product line under our Spaceman Lighting brand focused on functionality and affordability. To do so we will continue to scout the market place for existing technology and negotiate with manufacturers with lower MOQ amounts for assembling our products. 

Although there are challenges involved with establishing our company we do not see them as big problems as it all comes down to consumer demand. We believe our product will be popular enough for us to have enough sales to support the future expansion of the company.

An exciting product line awaits for those who love the integration of bright colorful lights to their daily life!

WWW.SPACEMANLIGHTING.COM

From Warm White
to Cool whiteThe only smart bulb
out right now where you can control the color temperature! From 3000k
which is a warm “yellow” light to 6000k which is a cool “white”
light. Again, we wanted to focus a little more on the functionality
of the light. For relaxing tasks like reading, a warm light will
provide more comfort. For practical tasks like cleaning, a brighter
and crisp white light will help the eye to catch dirty spots in the
room.DimmableWe actually find it
funny our competitors claim to have a “smart” bulb when their
product lacks basic feature like dimming. The Spaceman smart bulb will be
able to go from full 100% down to 30% brightness. Be in control of your
light.Now for the fun
stuff: 


RGBGuests are coming
over? Time to set the mood! Latest RGB technology with technically
millions of colors to choose. Impress the lady or gentlemen you are
having over ;)



Group control

Control 1, 2, or 64
at once! Our grouping feature allows you to organize up to 64 bulbs
and control them as a single unit.

Music modeTurn your room into
a dance floor! Plug a few in and have it follow to the music - voila,
you are now the owner of the hottest club in town :D

TimerLet the light assist
you. Set wake up and sleep functions so you can have a more natural
rest. Doubles as a security feature in case you are out of town and
need to create the illusion of having someone in the house. 


With that many
features, how do we get our cost to be so low?

Harnessing the
efficiency of e commerce.

Shopify &
fulfilment centers

We have found the
top fulfilment centers used by Amazon sellers and narrowed it down to
the most reliable yet cost prudent warehouses. Also instead of
developing our own app we have licensed existing technology so we do
not need to include a recovery fee for the research and development
like the big guys. 


Most importantly, we
only plan to sell direct through Shopify. Most brands out there want
to wholesale their products to distributors so they have to set a
high retail price. Only by doing so they can attract distributors
with a healthy profit margin. Spaceman Lighting however understands
the competitive disadvantage of focusing on the b2b model instead of
the end user when selling having a narrow product line.
Once we have successfully launched the product we will get to working on expanding our product line right away. Our vision is to not only have E27 bulbs but also encompass different types of light sources, such as flexible LED strips as well as GU10 spot lights. Our goal is to able to let users fully control their lighting environment around them for under $100. 


Product Specs.


Wireless Spec: Bluetooth 4.0
Bluetooth Range: 15 meters
Power: 7w
Input Voltage: AC100-240V
Lumens: 690lm
Color temperature: 3000k-6000k & RGB 16 million colors
Supported OS: IPhone 4S/Android 4.3 & above
Safety Certifications: UL, cUL, CE



PRODUCT ROADMAP
1) SMART PHONE CONTROLLED FLEXIBLE LED STRIPS.
2) 5w VERSION OF THE BULB FOR ONLY $19.95!
3) SMART PHONE CONTROLLED GU10 SPOTLIGHT.
4) INTEGRATION OF COLOR CHANGING LED TO EVERYDAY ITEMS
+ MANY MORE



Risks & Challenges



As long as the campaign goal is reached we are confident in fulfilling the promotional orders in this campaign. However, due to the competitiveness in this industry the challenge would be being able to sustain the project with our low margins to achieve a full on product line as explain in the our vision portion of the campaign.  
We hope to be able to offer a full product line under our Spaceman Lighting brand focused on functionality and affordability. To do so we will continue to scout the market place for existing technology and negotiate with manufacturers with lower MOQ amounts for assembling our products. 
Although there are challenges involved with establishing our company we do not see them as big problems as it all comes down to consumer demand. We believe our product will be popular enough for us to have enough sales to support the future expansion of the company.
An exciting product line awaits for those who love the integration of bright colorful lights to their daily life!





WWW.SPACEMANLIGHTING.COM

story:
http://basicincome.co is a first attempt at providing a decentralized safety net Network that can compete with the state. it uses an incentive-structure that´s the exact opposite of current tax-collection.

Imagine if you took your insurance company, bred it with kickstarter, mixed in some reward mechanisms and added a bit of Martin Luther King. Voila. A free market, incentive-based, welfare system.

Through implementing incentive-based voluntary taxation, the system is freed from the hierarchical social structure that is inherent to systems based on coercive force. Basicincome.co marks the end of the nation-state, and the beginning of a society based on voluntary participation and open collaboration.

Recently adopted by Bitnation, an internet-based political organization that´s a sort of Pirate Party 2.0, lead by TED-speaker Susanne Tarkowski Tempelhof , it´s been described as an 'astonishing system that can cater to individuals in a completely decentralized way, and lead the way for people to see the true power of decentralization and the peer-to-peer model.'.

I´m happy to present you with my recent work. This is the revolution.
-Johan Nygren, the creator




'You never change things by fighting the existing reality.To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete'
-Buckminster Fuller


What if we could create a free market welfare system that´s better than the state ?



Enter Basicincome.co - a revolutionary new technology. Imagine if you took your insurance company, bred it with kickstarter, mixed in some reward mechanisms and added a bit of Martin Luther King. Voila. A free market, incentive-based, welfare system, a revolutionary new idea, and a technology that´s already made a name for itself online. 



       

                                


                


           




Basic Income - Provided by Computers
http://coinssource.com/bitnation-decentralized-...

Bitnation announces basic income application 
http://mybitnation.tumblr.com/post/105873406725...

Bitnation announces a decentralized application for basic income
https://www.cryptocoinsnews.com/bitnation-announces-decentralized-application-basic-income-based-bitcoin-2-0-technology-voluntary-fees/

http://www.altcointoday.com/bitnation-announces-a-decentralized-application-for-basic-income-based-on-bitcoin-2-0-technology-and-voluntary-fees/

Bitnation to host basic income application 
http://cointelegraph.com/news/113199/bitnation-will-test-whether-basic-income-is-actually-workable

Decentralized app aims to provide basic income for all
http://newsbtc.com/2014/12/24/decentralized-app-aims-provide-basic-income/

Basicincome.co Q&A at Bitcoinference 2015 Amsterdam
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ot4RLJTxotU&amp...

Susanne Tarkowski Tempelhof, CEO of Bitnation, talks about incentive-based, personalized, safety nets
http://motherboard.vice.com/read/the-new-americ...

"We have a Bitnation 3rd Party DApp, called basicincome.co, developed by the Swedish prodigy Johan Nygren" 
http://hplusmagazine.com/2015/02/18/interview-bitcoin-pioneer-susanne-tarkowski-tempelhof-on-bitnation-and-m/

Decentralizing basic income: basicincome.co
https://moneyless.org/decentralizing-basic-income





*Basicincome.co is an application built on top of the RESILIENCE protocol. The RESILIENCE protocol is an evolution of to co-operative dividend-model, and a framework for secondary applications such as Basicincome.co. 



The RESILIENCE protocol

incentive-based dividend network with secondary applications

by @bipedaljoe



Introduction

Resilience, as I call my technology, is something new. There are no metaphors for it. It´s part welfare system, part co-operative dividends. Part state and part market. It blends those two narratives together, and obsoletes the dichotomy between the market and the state. Think of it as a decentralised, free market, welfare system.

Co-operatives that provide dividends for their costumers have been around forever, in one form or another. When the Swedish Co-operative KF was at its peak in the 1960s, it held as much as 25 percent of the entire Swedish market (1). The co-operative business model has been proven successful. RESILIENCE is a new web-standard for dividend co-operatives like KF. These co-operatives still use 20th century technology, and RESILIENCE attempts to bring co-operative businesses into the 21st century and the digital age.

 The RESILIENCE protocol hopes to establish a new standard for co-operativedividend networks much in the same way that the Ripple protocol has established a new standard for value exchange. The RESILIENCE protocol evolves the co-operative model, and hopes to establish a form of dividend network 2.0, that would provide all its members with a steady stream of income. This network would scale to the entire human population.






Dividend co-operatives in Sweden, 1950-present


"The dividend scheme makes it more advantageous to be a loyal Coop member. As more people realize the economic benefits, the idea is that more people will become members, more people will shop at Coop and that casual customers will transform into regulars and consolidate their purchases to Coop. This will make Coop more profitable, making it possible to further improve the stores and offers to members. "
-@CoopSverige, In Brief, 2010


Bitnation and Decentralised Autonomous Organisations (DAOs)


RESILIENCE is an internet-protocol for an incentive-based peer-to-peer dividend network. This dividend network could potentially scale to the entire human population, and would support each human with a steady stream of income, in proportion to each humans unique interactions with co-operatives around the world.

RESILIENCE also has potential as an alternative to nation-state-based coercive taxation. The dividends could replace parts of traditional social security, and RESILIENCE also provides a framework for secondary applications,  social services such as minimum guaranteed income, healthcare and schools.







WHAT IF WE COULD CREATE PEER-TO-PEER SAFETY NETS ?

The internet as a metaphor

The TCP/IP protocols of the internet have transformed the way we communicate. Information used to travel through a centralised network. We had to send our messages through a voice that could be heard, like the jungle drum, or the national media outlet. Social media has transformed that, and we now communicate pretty much peer-to-peer, and Ideas spread through a distributed network (c) rather than a centralised one (a)



The co-operative dividend-model has been designed for 20th century technology, and dividends are still shared based on a centralised design (a). The RESILIENCE protocol does for the co-operative model what social media did for communication, it brings it into the 21st century and the peer-to-peer model (c).


Dividend Pathways


Peer-to-peer dividend pathways

Every time you make a transaction with someone else inside the network, you create a dividend pathway. This pathway then connects you to that node, and also to everyone who´s connected to that node, and so on.





These pathways create the basic architecture of the network. Through them, you connect to your own unique network, that potentially scales and interconnects with a much waster network.



SECONDARY APPLICATIONS


The idea behind resilience is to empower co-operatives who use the dividend-model, and to give them a tool that they can use to support their community. RESILIENCE is a framework through which they can go beyond the limitations of the current model.

The question is really if there are enough co-operatives out there who would be interested in this, and I believe the answer is yes. Humans are wonderful, altruistic, and kind hearted. 

RESILIENCE also provides a framework for secondary applications, through which the users can choose to donate part of their dividends to different causes. The idea here is that if corporations find it in themselves to support their community, then perhaps the members of the community will find it in themselves to support the less fortunate, or to support community services such as a minimum guaranteed income, schools, and healthcare.



Donation-based social service applications on top of the RESILIENCE protocol


The incentive to pay tax to RESILIENCE is very different than traditional coercive-force-based incentives. RESILIENCE has potential to create a global scale dividend network through completely voluntary means.

RESILIENCE also has potential as a platform for secondary applications. The dividend-revenue that passes through the network might be made accessible to secondary applications. There might be a lower threshold for a person to choose to give away part of his dividends through voluntary means, then for that person to choose to give away his earnings. The dividends might be perceived as a form of reward, and the threshold to choose to give part of them to social services such as schools, healthcare or unconditional basic income (UBI) might be lower than the threshold to, voluntarily, pay taxes to those services directly. The dividends network also serves as a sort of map. The dividend pathways are unique in that they very closely resembles the real human interactions that underlie them. The interactions between people and their technology and surrounding environment, that are played out in real time, are mirrored almost perfectly. 

Your dividend pathways would be a form of map of your life playing out, and who and whom you shared your unfolding with. Any persons dividend pathways are an accurate representation of their social relationships, and any person might have dividend pathways that stretch all over the world. Each of these pathways tough exist in financial proximity to a network of its own. For example, if you live for just a short time in India, and create $2000 in dividend pathways, then these $2000 might be taxed as you receive your dividends through them.


If the RESILIENCE protocol works, it might be the ideal platform to use as for donating to social service applications. It would have a dedicated user-base that have joined through personal incentives, it would interface every financial platform online, and it would be built on a database that stores an (ever evolving) map over the state of the world. 



Basicincome.co 

basic income through donated dividends


Basicincome.co is an application that runs on top of the RESILIENCE protocol. Users within the RESILIENCE framework may choose to share their dividends with those in financial proximity to their dividend pathways. You would only donate to those who could be seen as part of your society, those who you have shared a financial and social proximity to. 

Through connecting Basicincome.co as an application, your dividend pathways would be made accessible to the application, and parts of your dividends would be used to fund an UBI for those in financial proximity to your pathways. Users who use Basicincome.co to receive UBI 'reach out' to dividend pathways that they are inter-connected and enmeshed with, and receive a boost so that their dividend yield reaches the amount that Basicincome.co has computed would cover basic needs.


BitNation Pangea and the P2P-paradigm


"20th December 2014, Kumasi, Ghana: the Decentralized Application (DApp) basicincome.co will be hosted on the Bitnation core platform - Bitnation Pangea - after its release in 2015. "
-Susanne Tarkowski Tempelhof, http://bitnation.co


This is an astonishing system that can cater to individuals in a completely decentralized way. This, added to the existing services which BitNation aims to provide on a global scale, can lead the way for people to see the true power of decentralization and the peer-to-peer model.
-Basic income - Provided by Computers, Coinssource.com





RESILIENCE: Co-operatives 2.0


The Incentive Structure - How does it work ?


The incentive layer designed by Johan Nygren is simple, yet powerful: if a person or corporation consumes from someone outside the network, they get disconnected. Only temporarily. If they buy for $100 from someone outside the network, they get disconnected for the duration it takes for $100 in dividends to flow through them. 

This is very meta and recursive because if a node gets disconnected, all their consumers also get disconnected, and so on. Which means that staying connected will make a node extremely attractive to others who want to stay connected.

This incentive mechanism was described brilliantly in the Coinssource.com article,

“This means that consumers who want to receive dividends will benefit greatly from seeking out co-operatives that are connected to the RESILIENCE protocol. Therefore, corporations are incited to join the network in their effort to gain and keep costumers. Not only will this mean that consumers can create a resilient financial safety net through making active consumerist choices. The corporations will also be encouraged to take greater financial responsibility for their entire supply line.”

So the idea is: Imagine you own a company, and imagine you choose to join Basicincome.co to support your network. The fact that you, and your supply chain, offer social security that is superior to what the state provides will not only make you a better person but will also make you more attractive to potential costumers. It´s a simple, yet powerful incentive structure.


Here´s a video by Johan that should give you a feeling of it,




Dividend Pathways - What are they ?


“In my Basic Income #DApp, your safety net emerges from the sum of your financial interactions, allowing you to live and evolve as a global and mobile citizen. Basicincome.co transforms the stage upon which we unfold.”
-From Coinssource.com´s feature about Basicincome.co





There´s already a test network online that gives a taste of what the finished product promises to do, and a live visual representation of it is online at graph_dev.basicincome.co. You can even create an account of your own, and test what it feels like to grow your own personal safety net.








Basicincome.co provides you with your own unique safety net, and connects the world as the global economy it is.
-Johan Nygren, inventor of Basicincome.co






What we will do with the $20,000


The past 6 months have gone into developing prototypes and media content. The money we raise from this campaign will be invested in developing a more scalable server architecture, as well as the development of stand alone apps that provide extended support for coins outside the Ripple ecosystem, and the next release will support BitCoin, Ethereum, NXT, Ripple, and will provide APIs that simplify the process of integrating new coins with the Basicincome.co application.

With the help of you backers, we´ll be able to finish this technology this year, 2015, and we believe that our incentive-based peer-to-peer safety net system will be a key technology for the society of the future. Basicincome.co will continue to be an open-source and creative commons asset, and the innovations that we put online will probably come to change the world in ways very similar to the TCP/IP protocols that gave birth to the internet 30 years ago.



Technical: Connect any bank-provider 


Basicincome.co has been designed to work with every bank-provider online. Think Ripple, Bitcoin, Ethereum. It also provides technical support for old nation-state-tech like US-banks and Swedish-banks and so on that want to upgrade their API to work with Basicincome.co. 

The way this works is technically simple. Ripple and Bitcoin have open APIs, so Basicincome.co has full knowledge of its users transactions. Basicincome.co then keeps tracks of how much dividends each user should contribute, and to whom. The users then need to sign in from time to time to pay out their dividends, or connect an app that automates this process.



Technical: BitTorrent-like Optimization Algorithm


The DApp uses a really simple dividend algorithm - it computes that you share dividends with everyone who´s connected to your swarm. It then adds an optimization algorithm that routes and optimizes that traffic. This limits the traffic load on each financial platform (eg Ripple, Bitcoin).







Technical: Security, Privacy and Cryptography


The DApp does not need access to your cryptographic keys. Basicincome.co creates a list of dividend payments, and you then sign them client-side. These payments could even be issued manually by you from your bank-app, or you could use a client that automates that process. Basicincome.co then reads your ledger and updates your server-side data.

Check out these clients for an example,

http://connect.basicincome.co/#/
http://update.basicincome.co











Videos / more perspectives and angles,













The RESILIENCE protocol


Basicincome.co is built on the RESILIENCE protocol, a standardised framework for peer-to-peer dividend networks.


Screenshot of the whitepaper-sketch on http://resilience.me -->

Therefore, corporations are incited to join the network in their effort to gain and keep costumers. Not only will this mean that consumers can create a resilient financial safety net through making active consumerist choices. The corporations will also be encouraged to take greater financial responsibility for their entire supply line.”



So the idea is: Imagine you own a company, and imagine you choose to join Basicincome.co to support your network. The fact that you, and your supply chain, offer social security that is superior to what the state provides will not only make you a better person but will also make you more attractive to potential costumers. It´s a simple, yet powerful incentive structure.Here´s a video by Johan that should give you a feeling of it,




Dividend Pathways - What are they ?


“In my Basic Income #DApp, your safety net emerges from the sum of your financial interactions, allowing you to live and evolve as a global and mobile citizen. Basicincome.co transforms the stage upon which we unfold.”-From Coinssource.com´s feature about Basicincome.co








There´s already a test network online that gives a taste of what the finished product promises to do, and a live visual representation of it is online at graph_dev.basicincome.co. You can even create an account of your own, and test what it feels like to grow your own personal safety net.










Basicincome.co provides you with your own unique safety net, and connects the world as the global economy it is.-Johan Nygren, inventor of Basicincome.co




What we will do with the $20,000
The past 6 months have gone into developing prototypes and media content. The money we raise from this campaign will be invested in developing a more scalable server architecture, as well as the development of stand alone apps that provide extended support for coins outside the Ripple ecosystem, and the next release will support BitCoin, Ethereum, NXT, Ripple, and will provide APIs that simplify the process of integrating new coins with the Basicincome.co application.With the help of you backers, we´ll be able to finish this technology this year, 2015, and we believe that our incentive-based peer-to-peer safety net system will be a key technology for the society of the future. Basicincome.co will continue to be an open-source and creative commons asset, and the innovations that we put online will probably come to change the world in ways very similar to the TCP/IP protocols that gave birth to the internet 30 years ago.




Technical: Connect any bank-provider 
Basicincome.co has been designed to work with every bank-provider online. Think Ripple, Bitcoin, Ethereum. It also provides technical support for old nation-state-tech like US-banks and Swedish-banks and so on that want to upgrade their API to work with Basicincome.co. The way this works is technically simple. Ripple and Bitcoin have open APIs, so Basicincome.co has full knowledge of its users transactions. Basicincome.co then keeps tracks of how much dividends each user should contribute, and to whom. The users then need to sign in from time to time to pay out their dividends, or connect an app that automates this process.
Technical: BitTorrent-like Optimization Algorithm
The DApp uses a really simple dividend algorithm - it computes that you share dividends with everyone who´s connected to your swarm. It then adds an optimization algorithm that routes and optimizes that traffic. This limits the traffic load on each financial platform (eg Ripple, Bitcoin).

Technical: Security, Privacy and Cryptography
The DApp does not need access to your cryptographic keys. Basicincome.co creates a list of dividend payments, and you then sign them client-side. These payments could even be issued manually by you from your bank-app, or you could use a client that automates that process. Basicincome.co then reads your ledger and updates your server-side data.Check out these clients for an example, http://connect.basicincome.co/#/http://update.basicincome.co
